fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • The figure given in a headline (EU under attack for spending over €200m on promotion of meat, 15 February, page 40) was incorrect. As the article made clear, €200m is the annual EU subsidy for the “promotion of agricultural products” but the amount spent on meat marketing campaigns has been calculated at €60m in the past three years. • Other recently corrected articles include: Earth just had hottest January since records began, data shows Macron sets out 10-year vision for EU with call for more integration The drive for Scottish independence is distinct from nationalism Higher alcohol taxes to fund NHS would benefit poor – study Russian artist and girlfriend held over release of Paris politician’s sex video
